page.title: 02SHAW HEATH, KNUTSFORD
page.content: I live in a council flat. All the houses on the estate which is divided by the Mobberley Road are built of brick. Mostly they have 3 to 4 bed- rooms. Some, like mine, are split up into flats. We have a gas fire and gas cooker, some have coal fires. There is a park across the road. It has a slide, one swing and two climbing frames; the other play things have been wrecked by vandals. Near the park is a small wood. The Macclesfield Groundwork Trust has laid proper foot- paths through this and put benches at intervals. Quite near to our house is a small group of shops including a newsagents, wine shop, D.I.Y. store and supermarket, the Doctor's surgery and a petrol filling station. Further along the road is the Post Office and a small new private housing estate where the old paper mill used to be.
